dynamic_line:
While wizards spends their lives burried in books to understand magic, your power stems from your innately magical bloodline.  Magic is your birthright.
Instead of studdying books, you increase in power by slaying monsters.

The standard sorcerer gains a caster level bonus based on their intelligence, but some bloodlines changes this.
That being said, what exactly is your bloodline?

You're a fairly standard sorcerer.  You gain no special strengths or weaknesses.
Your caster level is boosted by your intelligence.
You can pick one spell to be your favoured spell.  This boosts the starting level of that spell to 3.  This does not stack with spell level increases gained from leveling up as a sorcerer.
Is this your bloodline?

Magic is in the blood of every sorcerer, but for you it's more literal.  Your magical powers surges as your blood does.
Your caster level bonus is based off of stength instead of intelligence.  You get an extra boost during adrenaline rushes, but you take a penalty if you lose too  much blood.
Is this your bloodline?

As a spelldancer, you empower your magic though dance and acrobatics.  The elegance of your movements is matched only by the power of your spells.
Your caster level bonus is based off of effective dodge instead of intelligence.  You have learned a martial art that focuses on casting spells while dodging attacks to power up your unarmed strikes from the mana spent.
Is this your bloodline?

Some say you are of divine origin.  And perhaps there is some truth to that, for just like the Gods, you too draw your power from being worshiped.
Instead of intelligence, your caster level is boosted by your number of followers.  You also start out with two followers.
Is this your bloodline?  (NYI)

Rather than drawing power from your bloodline, you have learned to draw it from your family heirloom; a deck of tarot cards.
Intead of picking known spells as you level up, you draw a hand of random spells each day.
Is this your bloodline?  (NYI)
